title: 107_s179
content: Phase-In of Full Estate Tax Deduction for Family-Owned Business Interests: Amendment to section 2057(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the maximum deduction for family-owned business interests. The estate tax deduction amounts for decedents dying after specific dates are $2,375,000 (2000), $4,375,000 (2001), $6,375,000 (2002), $8,375,000 (2003), and $9,375,000 (2004). Unused spousal deduction amount applies to decedents whose predeceased spouse met certain requirements. The applicable deduction amount for the estate of a predeceased spouse is compared to the sum of the deduction amount and any increase in the estate's unified credit. Amendments are made to ensure coordination with the unified credit. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code relating to coordination with the unified credit, including the removal of dollar limitations for family-owned business interests. These changes apply to estates of decedents dying after December 31, 2000. The amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code apply to estates of decedents dying after December 31, 2005. SEC. 2. INCREASE IN UNIFIED CREDIT AGAINST ESTATE AND GIFT TAXES. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust the applicable credit amount for estate and gift taxes. The applicable credit amount is determined based on the tentative tax calculated using the rate schedule in section 2001(c) and includes the applicable exclusion amount and the applicable unused spousal exclusion amount for certain decedents. The estate tax exclusion amount for decedents and gifts made during different years is as follows: $1,000,000 for 2001 and 2002, $1,125,000 for 2003 and 2004, $1,500,000 for 2005, and $2,000,000 for 2006 onwards. Additionally, the applicable unused spousal exclusion amount is calculated for decedents whose spouse passed away after December 31, 2000. The amendment allows for the applicable exclusion amount to be transferred to the estate of a predeceased spouse. This amendment applies to estates of decedents dying and gifts made after December 31, 2000.
